location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.165 of 1856 from Commander Felix Jones, Acting Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Henry Anderson, Secretary to the Government of Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter relates to compensation to be paid for the plunder of cargo from a shipwrecked vessel at Sharjah. Jones writes that it has come to his attention that the inhabitants of Himireyah [Ḩamrīyah] were involved in the appropriation of cargo. Jones also discusses the estimates of the losses of the cargo, the vessel’s salvage value, and the abduction of a man from Koong island by the inhabitants of Ḩamrīyah.
